item.title: 【Prioritizing Cloud Security Risks: A Developer's Guide to Tackling Security Debt】优先考虑云安全风险：解决安全债务的开发指南
item.description:
【

In this era of ever-growing digital footprint, decreasing security debt has become so critical for organizations operating in the cloud. The myriads of unresolved security findings expose services vulnerable to emerging threats as well as pose risk to compliance and governance. The solution requires organizations to develop an efficient method for prioritizing security risks based on severity levels across different teams to tackle this problem at scale.

A forward-thinking solution involves creating a centralized security graph that merges various risk and compliance signals into one unified view. Such platforms enable engineering teams and security teams to discover and manage their most critical security risks by assessing their real business impact and risk severity rather than their age or backlog size.

】

在这个不断增长的数字足迹时代，减少安全债务对于在云中运作的组织变得如此重要。无数未解决的安全发现暴露了容易受到新兴威胁的服务以及对合规和治理的构成风险。该解决方案要求组织开发一种有效的方法来根据不同团队的严重程度的严重程度确定安全风险，以便在大规模解决此问题。

一种前瞻性的解决方案涉及创建一个集中的安全图，将各种风险和合规性信号合并为一个统一的视图。这样的平台使工程团队和安全团队能够通过评估其实际业务影响和风险严重性而不是年龄或积压大小来发现和管理其最关键的安全风险。

item.title: 【Creating a Web Project: Caching for Performance Optimization】创建网络项目：用于性能优化的缓存
item.description:
【

In one of the previous articles on identifying issues in your project, “Creating a Web Project: Key Steps to Identify Issues,” we discussed how to analyze application performance and how collecting metrics can assist in this task. However, identifying a problem is only the first step; action must be taken to resolve it. Caching is arguably one of the most effective and widely used methods for accelerating your application. 

The principle behind it is that instead of performing complex operations each time, we temporarily save the result of those operations and return it for subsequent similar requests if the inputs have not changed. This way, the application can be sped up, load reduced, and overall stability improved. 

】

在以前的有关识别项目中问题的文章之一中，“创建Web项目：识别问题的关键步骤”，我们讨论了如何分析应用程序绩效以及如何收集指标可以帮助完成此任务。但是，确定问题只是第一步。必须采取行动来解决它。可以说，缓存是加速应用程序的最有效和广泛使用的方法之一。 

其背后的原理是，我们并非每次执行复杂操作，而是暂时保存这些操作的结果，并在输入没有更改时将其返回以获取后续的类似请求。这样，可以加速应用程序，减少负载并改善整体稳定性。

item.title: 【How to Merge HTML Documents in Java】如何合并Java的HTML文档
item.description:
【

Java developers are often handed the challenge of consolidating documents in efficient file processing workflows.  With this prompt, HTML might not be the first document format that comes to mind — we might think of “file processing” as pertaining to robust, “business-y” formats like PDF or Excel first and foremost — but HTML’s importance in many modern enterprise environments can’t be understated. Whether it's a question of processing data pulled together from multiple online sources, piecing scraped web pages together, or consolidating custom web-based reports, programmatically combining and packaging HTML content is often highly relevant.

In this article, we’ll take a closer look at what it means to merge HTML content programmatically, and we’ll point out some of the specific challenges Java developers can expect to encounter in this endeavor. Towards the end, we’ll touch on some open-source libraries and third-party APIs we can use to build HTML merging capabilities into a file processing workflow, carefully weighing the benefits of each approach.

】

Java开发人员通常会在有效的文件处理工作流程中合并文档的挑战。  有了这个提示，HTML可能不是想到的第一种文档格式 - 我们可能会认为“文件处理”与强大的，“ business-y”格式有关，例如PDF或Excel，首先也是最重要的 - 但是HTML在许多现代企业环境中的重要性却无法低估。无论是处理从多个在线资源中获取的数据，将刮擦的网页拼凑在一起的问题还是合并基于自定义的基于Web的报告，编程方式结合和包装HTML内容通常非常相关。

在本文中，我们将仔细研究以编程方式合并HTML内容的含义，我们将指出Java开发人员可以期望在这项工作中遇到的一些具体挑战。最后，我们将介绍一些可以使用的开源库和第三方API，以将HTML合并功能构建到文件处理工作流程中，仔细权衡每种方法的好处。
